data.title: KGK...A good place to come back to...Luv Lamb!
data.text:
My wife and I were joined by my father-in-law at Kentro Greek Kitchen (KGK), a place that we should visit more often. We started off with a bottle of a Greek Red with some appetizers of Grilled Calamari, Zucchini Chips and a Beet salad.  Salad was interesting, as it seemed that I was the only one enjoying it:  Marinated vinaigrette beets, with figs, walnuts and manouri cheese! It was quite good. 

To cut on wait time, as you enter, you order your food and drinks off a wall menu or a menu is  given to you. You pay at the cash register and off you go to find an available table. Not bad, and it works for me, if its not crowded. However, parking is a bit of a problem, on a busy night, it would be rare to find available parking in front of KGK, since there are only about 4-5 parking spaces. Hopefully, the KGK staff are not parking in those spots. But, if you don't mind, a small 1 block walk, you might find some available in the parking area next to several other restaurants who customers are looking to jump in your spot.  

All in all, we had a good time in this small but comfortable open bar kitchen atmosphere.

data.title: Excellent food in a sleek, modern setting
data.text:
Kentro Greek Kitchen is located in downtown Fullerton; it shares a parking lot with the Fullerton Transportation Center as well as numerous restaurants and night clubs.  The area can get very busy so allow yourself a few minutes to hunt for a parking space.  You order at the counter and your food is delivered to you at your table.  You usually associate this service style with eateries more focused on speed of service than food quality, but that is not the case here.  The cuisine is excellent.

We started with the calamari saganaki appetizer; the tender calamari (not the common deep fried variety) is served in a sauce of tomato, garlic and feta, and is accompanied by slices of their delicious rustic bread.  For our entrees, my son and I ordered a couple of classic Greek dishes, souvlaki and moussaka (both of which were excellent), while my wife went with the more unusual (and outstanding) Manouri flat bread that featured Manouri cheese, figs, arugula, oregano, honey and olive oil.  We finished off our meal by sharing a delightful order of Loukoumades (a Greek beignet topped with honey and vanilla ice cream).

The service is friendly and helpful, and the contemporary décor definitely does not scream “fast food.”  Be forewarned that you will be paying prices that are comparable to those of a full service restaurant.  We felt the quality of the food warranted the price and we fully intend to return in the future.

data.title: Delish!
data.text: Vary casual, clean and friendly place to get a bite to eat.  French fries are deadly because they just can't make any better.  I had a chicken wrap with fries and my hubby ordered the kabab, very tasty, generous portions and great service.  Not like greek home cooking but non the less, very good.  I recommend this place to anyone who enjoys quality.

data.title: Greek'in Great!
data.text: Kentro's in downtown Fullerton is a great casual Greek restaurant.  Kentro's has a very pleasant and comfy vibe to it and the staff are all very friendly, (good looking) and helpful.   You order at the counter and they deliver the food and drinks to your table.  Yes, they have beer and wine and a nice little bar to sit at if you like (my personal choice).  My favorite is the Manouri flat bread with the dried figs.....so good!  Give it a try....you won't be disappointed.

data.title: My favorite Greek place
data.text: It's casual, you order at counter and they deliver to your table. The waiter staff is supper nice and the food is great.

data.title: Casual atmosphere, great eats!
data.text: Kentros is our favorite Greek eatery in Orange County.  Food is consistently good.  You order at the counter and food is delivered in a timely manner.  Salads are excellent.  Flatbreads are the best ever.  Parking is sometimes a challenge in the busy downtown Fullerton area. Restaurant can get crowded during busy hours.

data.title: Casual delicious Greek
data.text: Kentro is run by childhood friends who are Greek.  The food here is excellent and very authentic.  The eggplant dip, the salads -- one with beets and walnuts, another with cherry tomatoes and feta cheese dressing -- and the lamb chops are all outstanding.  Greek coffee too, along with wines and beers.  May lack ambience but reasonable and yummy.  My great-nieces love sitting at the high counter and tables.

data.title: With friends
data.text: This place is amazing. Great staff and the food is oh so good!!!! We will be back ! Love the Kentro fries but the best was the Manouri flat bread with dried figs and honey!

data.title: A little piece of Greece
data.text: Man those lamb chops are to die for, also try the gyro and the salad and bread...not like olive garden...Wayyy Better.

data.title: An excellent spot for creative mediterranean food
data.text:
Kentros is an incredible place! I have eaten here on and off for several years (probably four or more). The food is delicious no matter which meal I choose. I highly recommend the Souvlaki with chicken, any of the pitas, or the Menouri flat bread. They're Greek coffee is also great. Several times I have introduced different people to Kentros and virtually every time they tell me it is their new favorite. 

I also cannot say enough good things about the owner and the servers. All the girls are super pleasant, sociable, and do a wonderful job making sure everything is how you like it. Cannot recommend it highly enough!

data.title: Great food
data.text: My daughter and I have lunch here often.  You order and pay at the register and the food is served by wonderful servers. I love the Walnut and Fig salad.  mmmmm!

data.title: A great place for Greek food
data.text: It takes us 1 1/2 hours to reach this place but it is worth the drive. The lamb chops, meatballs, flatbread salads in fact everything is a delight. Our go to place for Greek food

data.title: Kentros Greek Kitchen
data.text:
Last Sunday my date and myself were in the mood for some local Greek food so we
Tried this place... I had the pan fried
Sea bass which was dry..The roasted corn it came w was great! My date had the lamb sandwich on
Pita bread and enjoyed it...The service was quite good and we had ice tea w a delicious lettuce butter lettuce salad with cherry tomatoes and feta cheese and vinaigrette dressing... We shall return....

data.title: Love the greek salad
data.text: This was a great place to host our monthly girls dinner. We all got to share a variety of foods and taste something different. We really enjoyed the pizzas, the salads and the appetizers.

data.title: If You Love Greek Food This Is A Great Place
data.text: We have eaten here twice and good is delicious and nice waiters.  You go to the counter to order.  If felt it a little noicy but I would go back again for their wonderful Greek food!

data.title: Fast, clean, friendly
data.text: order at the cashier and they bring it to your table.  setting is nicer than most of these types of places and has a modern vibe.  Food is excellent.  Pita's were good as was the corn.  Someone at our table had the lamb and thought it was great.

data.title: not your typical fast food place
data.text: Very different menu and a lot more authentic then places like Daphne's. Good food and fair prices. You order at the counter and they bring the food to you. Clean pleasant place and a nice change for "fast" food

data.title: Great eclectic menu
data.text:
This was my first time here. It had a very varied menu of greek inspired dishes.

I started with the olive tapenade. It was very good and had the perfect taste. The rustic bread that accompanied it was also very good. Next I had the lemon chicken soup. It was perfectly flavored and piping hot. Lastly I has the lamb flatbread pizza. It was huge. I should have asked as I was expecting something small. The pizza was good but I did not care for the lamb that was on it. 

Plenty of parking behind the restaurant next to the train station.

data.title: Cheaper than a Trip to Greece
data.text: Based on the food quality -- this place is easily 5 Stars. Flavor just oozes out of every bite of food they make. My wife and I had the lamb chops and they were succulent, tender, and spiced perfectly. I had the Greek salad with my order and it was the best I have ever had!! My wife had fries and they were just fantastic! Crisp and with just a hint of spices. The baklava was also top notch. So, you ask, why only four stars? Well, they have this system of ordering at a counter, paying for your food and then it is delivered to your table. I just find that system not conducive to a fine dining experience. As a first-timer, I did not feel free to ask questions about several menu items with a line of patrons waiting behind me to get their order in. With a personal wait staff, you feel as if you can explore the menu, ask for recommendations and explanations without inconveniencing anyone else in the restaurant. The system also breaks down if you want anything else with your meal (like baklava). Finding someone who will claim you as a patron they will wait on for an after-sale was very difficult. Most of the wait staff just ignored us and we had to get aggressive just to get their attention. But, I'll say it again, the food was worth it!!!

data.title: Distracted and Inattentive service
data.text: The servers were distracted. The food was average. The prices were not cheap. After being seated for 20 minutes we had to remind them that we ordered wine. It was not a pleasant experience.
